Name: Beanfield Centre
Summary: Beanfield Centre is Canada’s first LEED Silver conference centre, designed for meetings, conventions and galas. Located in the former Automotive Building, this Art Deco masterpiece offers spectacular lakeside views and is connected to Enercare Centre which offers 1 million square feet of exhibition space.
Description:
The highlights

  • Largest ballroom in Toronto at 43,900 sf (divisible in two).
  • 20 meeting rooms on the second floor some offering natural light (all with AV blackout capability).
  • Environmental building systems for 100% green-powered HVAC.
  • 5 open lounges with natural light at the 2nd-floor level.
  • Three pre-function spaces with natural light at the main ground floor level.

You should know

  • F&B by Cerise Fine Catering
  • Low VOC paints and carpets
  • Rainwater Harvesting
  • Wi-Fi 6 internet, also called 802.11ax, it is poised to make big waves in network connectivity and user experience improvement.

The detail

The Automotive Building is a heritage building at Exhibition Place in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, containing event and conference space. In the 1920s, as a result of burgeoning interest in automobiles, additional exhibition space for automotive exhibits during the annual Canadian National Exhibition was needed

Name: Centre des congrès de Québec
Summary: The Québec City Convention Centre is a true leader in sustainable development and applies high standards in environmental management on a daily basis to provide a place where you can have a great event today without harming tomorrow. What’s more, you will be making a positive impact on the community.
Description:
With our sustainable vision for the world of events and conventions, we believe that everyone who benefits from the Convention Centre’s infrastructure has a role to play.

Event organizers can rely on our qualified team and equipment, exhibitors can contribute to our efforts to collect and manage waste materials, and visitors and participants can embrace a few simple green habits, among other things.

Name: The Great Hall
Summary: Sure, here's a revised version of the content based on your instructions: --- The Great Hall stands as the ultimate event destination in the vibrant heart of Toronto's West End. With its striking red brick facade and meticulously restored interiors, it’s a living piece of history that beautifully marries Victorian charm with modern elegance. Discover four unique venues that bring timeless style into the twenty-first century, making every event a memorable experience!
Description:
Step into history at The Great Hall, a cherished landmark nestled in the vibrant West Queen West neighborhood of Toronto. Originally built in 1889 and meticulously restored in 2016, this venue seamlessly blends classic charm with modern convenience.

With 20,000 sq. ft. of versatile event space, The Great Hall boasts state-of-the-art amenities, including an advanced HVAC system, an accessibility elevator, dedicated high-speed internet, and concert-quality sound and lighting. Our four distinct venues are designed to adapt to your unique needs, whether you're planning an intimate gathering for two or a grand celebration for up to 1,200 guests. Experience the perfect backdrop for your next unforgettable event at The Great Hall.

Name: Chateau Le Jardin Event Venue
Summary: The Chateau isn't just a venue; it's an experience! Its breathtaking architecture, sophisticated vibe, and top-notch service make it the go-to place for any event. And with Le Jardin's legendary knack for crafting unforgettable moments, your celebration is bound to be one for the books!
Description:
East Wing

  • The East Wing venue specs include 8,000 square feet of stunning event space, three private entrances, two private lobbies and its stunning design featuring soaring 26 foot hand sculpted ceilings, private washrooms and three newly renovated bars. The venue features a state of the art audio & visual system including completely integrated sound with JBL subwoofers, table lighting (pin spot & custom lighting available), intelligent lighting with moving head fixtures, LED covered ceilings, motorized drop down projector screens with HD projectors and in-house DJ booths. Finally with modular noise cancelling air walls, The East Wing Venue can be divided into three smaller event spaces named The Renaissance, Champagne, and Le Parisien Ballrooms.

West Wing

  • The West Wing Ballroom venue specs are many, starting with over 12,000 square feet of event space, three private entrances all complimented by elegant and soaring 24 foot hand sculpted ceilings, extensive moldings and intricate wall plaques. It is fully functional with three gorgeous, newly renovated bars, a state of the art audio and visual system, private washrooms, movable noise cancelling air walls that allow this room to be divided into three smaller event spaces called The Victorian, Venetian and Versailles Ballrooms (dimensions and capacities listed in the chart below). The audio & visual system includes a completely integrated sound complemented with JBL subwoofers, table lighting (pin spot & custom lighting available), intelligent lighting with moving head ﬁxtures, LED coffered ceilings, motorized drop down projection screens with HD projectors and in-house DJ booths.‍

Name: Victoria Conference Centre
Summary: The Victoria Conference Centre (VCC) enriches the local community by attracting business and economic opportunities, delivering top-notch conference services, and offering sustainable, energy-efficient facilities.
Description:
The Victoria Conference Centre (VCC) stands as a stunning homage to the cultures and traditions that make Victoria a great place to connect. As the city’s largest conference facility, the VCC is an ideal venue for hosting eco-friendly meetings and events, offering comprehensive sustainability measures such as energy-efficiency, water conservation, and waste management. Working with the Offsetters Community, the VCC aims to measurably reduce environmental impacts.

Located on First Nations land, the VCC’s logo, featuring three salmon heads created by First Nations artist Chris Paul, symbolizes the mission of bringing people from across the world together and celebrates sacred aboriginal iconology.

A national leader in conference hosting, the VCC leverages over 35 years of experience to cater to a diverse mix of businesses and professional associations, providing a personalized approach to planning and hosting events of all sizes.

‍
